At a global scale, the annual total heat exposure over land areas increases linearly as a function of CCE for the four lowest WBGT thresholds selected. In the 1% CO 2 (CO 2-only) scenario, heat exposure above the light threshold increases by

Across all WBGT thresholds, the RCP scenarios show a more rapid and more robust increase in heat exposure compared to the 1% CO 2 scenario as a result of additional positive non-CO 2 forcing.
